result.markdown: Idris Baba[^index-1] [^index-1]: The Bartlett Centre for Advanced Spatial Analysis, ucfniib\@ucl.ac.uk ::: {.cell} ::: Last updated: 2025-03-18 ## Welcome {.unnumbered} Hello and welcome to the Term 2 module Remotely Sensing Cities and Environments. This learning diary is part of the course taught at CASA in Term 2 MSc module, CASA00023, this website is a reflection of all the content of this module. [CASA00023 Remotely Sensing Cities and Environment](https://andrewmaclachlan.github.io/CASA0023) although these contents, are only the contents I find interesting and most beneficial for my career. ## Intended course learning outcomes By the end of this module I will become familiar with these concepts: - Create a reproducible online **portfolio workbook** - Explain and evaluate common issues with urban and environmental policies at the local, national and international level that fail to consider spatial data - Revise vague and ambiguous development targets - Appropriately pre-process Earth observation imagery ready for analysis - Apply published methodologies to extract meaning from Earth observation data - Combine a variety of spatial data to demonstrate the benefits of data-informed governance and planning. - Create and design a reproducible workflow for consistent monitoring of urban and environmental metrics - Critique and optimise recently developed metropolitan climate mitigation strategies using appropriate spatial data, optimizing financial investment and environmental outcomes ## Acknowledgement {.unnumbered} Thanks to **Andy** who inspired me to build this learning diary as part of my assessment, most of the styles and format is gotten from his repo : - [Dr Andy Maclachlan](https://x.com/andymaclachlan), The R package and analysis used within this book has been inspired by [Andy](https://github.com/andrewmaclachlan), I've certainly learnt a lot from his open code repository!
